meanings.def: a small piece of metal or plastic, with a design or words on it, that a person wears or carries to show that they belong to an organization, support something, have achieved something, have a particular rank, etc.
examples: She wore a badge saying ‘Vote for Coates’.
All employees have to wear name badges.
He pulled out a badge and said he was a cop.
The police officer flashed his badge.

meanings.def: a piece of material that you sew onto clothes as part of a uniform
a symbol of a particular quality or status
examples: His gun was a badge of power for him.
Her badge of office, a large gold key, hung around her neck.
He saw his injuries as a badge of honour.
